context: A security incident involving a successful logon using overpass-the-hash with potentially stolen credentials occurred on host `vnevado-win10b` using the account of SID S-1-5-21-1540151660-3530000288-105586595-1517. As part of following the activity, suspicious access to the LSASS service was detected, an indication that attackers might have been trying to decrypt user passwords from memory. Later, a known credential theft tool execution was detected indicating an attempt to dump user credentials.
question: Can you identify the process ID and command line of the malicious credential theft tool that was executed?
solution_steps: An attacker used the process `lsass.exe` to perform an overpass-the-hash attack.
A suspicious access was detected to the LSASS service with SID `S-5-7-21-1843151660-3234030288-105586167-1422`.

A malicious credential theft tool `mimikatz.exe` was executed with Process ID `4748` at `2024-06-27t14:33:38.0249949z` with the command line `mimikatz.exe lsadump::dcsync /domain:vnevado.alpineskihouse.co /user:xfbzkp exit`.
